body.head: Poem
body.octave: When your left arm twitches it's like sunlight on sugar to me and my tongue seeks the sea of your skin, its oily calm of green light on the floor of the ocean as in parting, there's a flutter between us
body.sestet: while I haul down a flag and you look absently out of my heart so you won't see what light one fears in the sea that I don't want you to know is of you in me
